brief_description: "Free Pre-Recruitment Training" is a social security scheme that provides free of cost pre-recruitment training to the sons of the ex-servicemen for the recruitment in Army/Para-Military Forces and Police Forces.
detailed_description: "Free Pre-Recruitment Training" is a social security scheme by the State Sainik Board, Government of Uttarakhand. Under this scheme, free of cost pre-recruitment training of 8 weeks is provided to the sons of the ex-servicemen for the recruitment in Army/Para-Military Forces and Police Forces.
benefits: Free of cost pre-recruitment training to the sons of the ex-servicemen for the recruitment in the Army/ Para-Military Forces, and Police Forces. The entire training expenses (honorarium + food + accommodation) are paid by the Directorate of Sainik Welfare.
Note: Five courses are conducted in a year.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a son of an ex-serviceman. The applicant's age should be between 16-21 years. The applicant should have passed high school with 45% marks.

steps: Step 1: Applications for the course are first invited through publicity by the Office of the Director of Sainik Welfare. Step 2: Fill the form properly and attach all the documents (attested, if required). Step 3: Submit the form as directed by the Office of the Director of Sainik Welfare.

documents_required: Application Form. Proof of Birth. Aadhar Card. Educational Certificate (at least passed High School / Higher Secondary Examination ). Medical Certificate. Ex-Servicemen Identity Card. Discharge Book.
